tourName: Charming Luxury Austria Itinerary for Families
generalInfo: Austria is magnificent for families and is a country where there is time and space to come together as one. Featuring four distinctive destinations, this 9-day Austria tour will have you exploring culture and nature together. Balloon over Salzkammergut, cycle the Danube, explore heritage and culture, and spend a day in a neolithic wonderland.

With a local guide you can customize a journey to your interests. Traveling from Melk to Durnstein may be too far but whatever route you choose, there will be castle ruins, small vineyards, and the laid-back atmosphere of rural Austria. Stop for lunch along the way and feel the freedom of the valley, before returning to Vienna for the evening.

dayInfo.title: Hallstatt â Hot Air Balloon Flight
dayInfo.description: Wake early this morning for a stunning flight over the Salzkammergut Lake District. Children aged over three can join the balloon ride. Soar into the air and admire the Alps, especially sharp peaks coated in snow almost every month of the year. From up here you can admire all the different lakes, along with forested mountain slopes and tiny wooden villages. The afternoon has been left free so you can explore more of Hallstatt. Itâs a great time to walk with children and youâre never far from a traditional cafe for a sweet treat.

dayInfo.title: Lienz â A Chalet in the Hills
dayInfo.description: From Hallstatt it will take around three hours to reach Lienz, a quiet mountain town in the Alps. The famous Glossglocker casts a shadow over the town, its snowy summit glowing in the midday light. You will be staying in a private chalet, just outside the town. It feels like an escape from the world here, just you and your family, the Alps stretching out in all directions. From the villa you can take a hiking trail into the valley, or you can stroll towards the town for a choice of restaurants.

dayInfo.title: Lienz â Customize Your Outdoor Adventure around the Glossglockner
dayInfo.description: Lienz is a great base for exploring Austriaâs highest mountain. While the Glossglockner initially looks imposing, itâs one of the most accessible peaks for families. An iconic road will take you just about to the summit. On the way up you can get out to enjoy a series of walking and biking trails. This is also a region for trying out rock climbing or kayaking, even white-water rafting. So today will be tailored to your interests by two adventure guides, as you come face to face with a countryâs most famous natural attraction.

dayInfo.title: Innsbruck â Pizza, Pasta, and Austria

dayInfo.title: Innsbruck â An Enchanting Old City
dayInfo.description: Travel even further back in time this morning as you visit Otzi-Dorf Umhausen, which is an archaeological park that transports you to the Stone Age. The entire site showcases life in the Neolithic period and there are opportunities to dress up and work as if this was 7000 years ago. Back in Innsbruck you will find a quiet old city with cobblestone streets and a mountain backdrop.
